**Astro** (Korean: 아스트로; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean boy band formed by Fantagio.[1] The group is composed of four members: MJ, Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, and Yoon San-ha.[2] Originally a six-piece group, Rocky departed from the group on February 28, 2023,[3] and Moonbin died on April 19, 2023.[4] They debuted on February 23, 2016, with the extended play *Spring Up* and were subsequently named as one of the best new K-pop acts of 2016 by *Billboard*.[5]




## Career[edit]

After their web drama finished airing, the group started the "Meet U" project. As part of the project, Astro traveled through South Korea, covering songs in front of crowds and holding fan meetings. Along with the performances, a KakaoTalk Plus Friends account was set up. Fantagio stated that once the group had gathered 10,000 friends on the app, they would announce their official debut date.[9] The goal was met by December 2015.[10] Their debut showcase, held on January 28, 2016, was sold out in under a minute and far exceeded the original limit of 1,000 attendants.[11][12] There, they also announced their official fan club name, Aroha.


They also appeared in their own reality TV show titled *Astro OK! Ready*, which began airing on January 21, 2016, on MBC every1[13] and concluded on February 18, 2016.[14]



### 2016: Debut with *Spring Up* and rising popularity[edit]

### Pre-debut[edit]


Astro was formed through the rookie talent development program "iTeen Boys", which was created by their agency Fantagio.[6] In August 2015, the final member line-up and group name were announced.[7] The same month, the group starred in a web drama titled *To Be Continued*, which aimed to introduce them to the public. The drama featured the members as themselves, as well as Kim Sae-ron, Seo Kang-joon, and the girl group Hello Venus.[8]

After their web drama finished airing, the group started the "Meet U" project. As part of the project, Astro traveled through South Korea, covering songs in front of crowds and holding fan meetings. Along with the performances, a KakaoTalk Plus Friends account was set up. Fantagio stated that once the group had gathered 10,000 friends on the app, they would announce their official debut date.[9] The goal was met by December 2015.[10] Their debut showcase, held on January 28, 2016, was sold out in under a minute and far exceeded the original limit of 1,000 attendants.[11][12] There, they also announced their official fan club name, Aroha.


They also appeared in their own reality TV show titled *Astro OK! Ready*, which began airing on January 21, 2016, on MBC every1[13] and concluded on February 18, 2016.[14]

### Pre-debut[edit]


Astro was formed through the rookie talent development program "iTeen Boys", which was created by their agency Fantagio.[6] In August 2015, the final member line-up and group name were announced.[7] The same month, the group starred in a web drama titled *To Be Continued*, which aimed to introduce them to the public. The drama featured the members as themselves, as well as Kim Sae-ron, Seo Kang-joon, and the girl group Hello Venus.[8]

<title>Cha Eun-woo</title>
<fragment>

**Lee Dong-min** (Korean: 이동민; born March 30, 1997), known professionally as **Cha Eun-woo** (차은우), is a South Korean singer and actor under the label Fantagio. He is a member of the South Korean boy band Astro.




## Early life[edit]


Cha Eun-woo was born on March 30, 1997 in the city of Gunpo, Gyeonggi Province.[2][3][4] He attended Suri Middle School and Suri High School before graduating from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2016.[5] He studied at Sungkyunkwan University, majoring in performing arts in the theater department.[6]



## Career[edit]


### 2013–2015: Career beginnings[edit]


Cha debuted as an actor in 2014 with a minor role in the film *My Brilliant Life*.[7] He was the fourth trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut. In August 2015, Cha, along with the other members of Astro, participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[8]



### 2016–present: Debut with Astro, solo activities and rising popularity[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band)

<fragment>

In November 2018, Cha was included as one of GQ Korea's Men of the Year.[20] In 2019, he ranked seventh—with 44,178,474 points—in the Most Accumulated Points On Male Idol Brand Reputation.[78][*unreliable source?*] In the K-pop Radar Year-End Chart of 2019, Cha was named as the male "Hot Instagrammer".[79]


In April 2021, Cha placed 17th on *Forbes* Korea Power Celebrity and sixth in the SNS category.[80] In April 2022, after Cha was selected to represent contemporary men's clothing brand Liberclassy,[55] traffic to the company's mall increased by 806% in the first week of April from the previous week, and the brand also saw an increase in social media engagement.[81] An official from Liberclassy said, "The Cha Eunwoo effect was seen as more than 70 million won in sales generated for pre-application alone".[82]

Astro debuted on February 23, 2016, with the EP *Spring Up*. In August, Cha participated in the Chuseok special variety show, *Replies That Make Us Flutter*.[9] In September, he participated in another Chuseok pilot program, *Boomshakalaka*.[10]


Cha was announced as a host of *Show! Music Core* alongside Kim Sae-ron, Lee Soo-min and Xiyeon from 2016 to 2018.[11] In 2016, he also starred in the web drama *My Romantic Some Recipe*.[12]


In 2017, Cha was cast in the KBS2 drama *Hit the Top*[13] and starred in the web drama *Sweet Revenge*.[14]


In 2018, Cha starred in the web drama *Top Management*.[15] He was later cast in the JTBC romantic comedy series *Gangnam Beauty*, his first leading role on television.[16][17] He saw a rise in popularity after the series aired[18][19] and was included in GQ Korea's "Men of the Year".[20]

<document>
<title>Cha Eun-woo</title>
<fragment>

**Lee Dong-min** (Korean: 이동민; born March 30, 1997), known professionally as **Cha Eun-woo** (차은우), is a South Korean singer and actor under the label Fantagio. He is a member of the South Korean boy band Astro.




## Early life[edit]


Cha Eun-woo was born on March 30, 1997 in the city of Gunpo, Gyeonggi Province.[2][3][4] He attended Suri Middle School and Suri High School before graduating from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2016.[5] He studied at Sungkyunkwan University, majoring in performing arts in the theater department.[6]



## Career[edit]


### 2013–2015: Career beginnings[edit]


Cha debuted as an actor in 2014 with a minor role in the film *My Brilliant Life*.[7] He was the fourth trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut. In August 2015, Cha, along with the other members of Astro, participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[8]



### 2016–present: Debut with Astro, solo activities and rising popularity[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band)

## Awards and nominations[edit]

<fragment>

In November 2018, Cha was included as one of GQ Korea's Men of the Year.[20] In 2019, he ranked seventh—with 44,178,474 points—in the Most Accumulated Points On Male Idol Brand Reputation.[78][*unreliable source?*] In the K-pop Radar Year-End Chart of 2019, Cha was named as the male "Hot Instagrammer".[79]


In April 2021, Cha placed 17th on *Forbes* Korea Power Celebrity and sixth in the SNS category.[80] In April 2022, after Cha was selected to represent contemporary men's clothing brand Liberclassy,[55] traffic to the company's mall increased by 806% in the first week of April from the previous week, and the brand also saw an increase in social media engagement.[81] An official from Liberclassy said, "The Cha Eunwoo effect was seen as more than 70 million won in sales generated for pre-application alone".[82]



## Discography[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band) § Discography

Astro debuted on February 23, 2016, with the EP *Spring Up*. In August, Cha participated in the Chuseok special variety show, *Replies That Make Us Flutter*.[9] In September, he participated in another Chuseok pilot program, *Boomshakalaka*.[10]


Cha was announced as a host of *Show! Music Core* alongside Kim Sae-ron, Lee Soo-min and Xiyeon from 2016 to 2018.[11] In 2016, he also starred in the web drama *My Romantic Some Recipe*.[12]


In 2017, Cha was cast in the KBS2 drama *Hit the Top*[13] and starred in the web drama *Sweet Revenge*.[14]


In 2018, Cha starred in the web drama *Top Management*.[15] He was later cast in the JTBC romantic comedy series *Gangnam Beauty*, his first leading role on television.[16][17] He saw a rise in popularity after the series aired[18][19] and was included in GQ Korea's "Men of the Year".[20]

**Astro** (Korean: 아스트로; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean boy band formed by Fantagio.[1] The group is composed of four members: MJ, Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, and Yoon San-ha.[2] Originally a six-piece group, Rocky departed from the group on February 28, 2023,[3] and Moonbin died on April 19, 2023.[4] They debuted on February 23, 2016, with the extended play *Spring Up* and were subsequently named as one of the best new K-pop acts of 2016 by *Billboard*.[5]




## Career[edit]

After their web drama finished airing, the group started the "Meet U" project. As part of the project, Astro traveled through South Korea, covering songs in front of crowds and holding fan meetings. Along with the performances, a KakaoTalk Plus Friends account was set up. Fantagio stated that once the group had gathered 10,000 friends on the app, they would announce their official debut date.[9] The goal was met by December 2015.[10] Their debut showcase, held on January 28, 2016, was sold out in under a minute and far exceeded the original limit of 1,000 attendants.[11][12] There, they also announced their official fan club name, Aroha.


They also appeared in their own reality TV show titled *Astro OK! Ready*, which began airing on January 21, 2016, on MBC every1[13] and concluded on February 18, 2016.[14]

### Pre-debut[edit]


Astro was formed through the rookie talent development program "iTeen Boys", which was created by their agency Fantagio.[6] In August 2015, the final member line-up and group name were announced.[7] The same month, the group starred in a web drama titled *To Be Continued*, which aimed to introduce them to the public. The drama featured the members as themselves, as well as Kim Sae-ron, Seo Kang-joon, and the girl group Hello Venus.[8]

**Astro** (Korean: 아스트로; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean boy band formed by Fantagio.[1] The group is composed of four members: MJ, Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, and Yoon San-ha.[2] Originally a six-piece group, Rocky departed from the group on February 28, 2023,[3] and Moonbin died on April 19, 2023.[4] They debuted on February 23, 2016, with the extended play *Spring Up* and were subsequently named as one of the best new K-pop acts of 2016 by *Billboard*.[5]




## Career[edit]

<fragment>

After their web drama finished airing, the group started the "Meet U" project. As part of the project, Astro traveled through South Korea, covering songs in front of crowds and holding fan meetings. Along with the performances, a KakaoTalk Plus Friends account was set up. Fantagio stated that once the group had gathered 10,000 friends on the app, they would announce their official debut date.[9] The goal was met by December 2015.[10] Their debut showcase, held on January 28, 2016, was sold out in under a minute and far exceeded the original limit of 1,000 attendants.[11][12] There, they also announced their official fan club name, Aroha.


They also appeared in their own reality TV show titled *Astro OK! Ready*, which began airing on January 21, 2016, on MBC every1[13] and concluded on February 18, 2016.[14]

<fragment>

### Pre-debut[edit]


Astro was formed through the rookie talent development program "iTeen Boys", which was created by their agency Fantagio.[6] In August 2015, the final member line-up and group name were announced.[7] The same month, the group starred in a web drama titled *To Be Continued*, which aimed to introduce them to the public. The drama featured the members as themselves, as well as Kim Sae-ron, Seo Kang-joon, and the girl group Hello Venus.[8]

<title>Moonbin</title>
<fragment>

Moonbin began his journey with Fantagio as a trainee in fifth grade, eventually transitioning to a full-fledged trainee during his middle school years. He actively took part in the company's boy group project iTeen, and he was introduced through the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut.[6] Before his official debut with Astro, Moonbin and his fellow group members starred in a web-drama titled "*To Be Continued"*.[7]

In September 2020, Moonbin was announced as one of the fashion models for the brand Nerdy Cafe.[18] He and band-mate Sanha (Yoon San-ha) debuted as Astro's first sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha with the release of their debut EP, *In-Out*, along with its lead single, "Bad Idea", on September 14.[19] The unit received their first music show win from *The Show* eight days later.[20]

<fragment>

Moonbin was born on January 26, 1998, in Cheongju, Chungbuk Province. He attended and graduated from Hanlim Multi Art School, focusing in Practical Music.[2]


He was one of two siblings in his family, with a younger sister named Moon Sua, who is a member of the South Korean girl group Billlie.[3]



## Career[edit]


### 2006–2015: Pre-debut[edit]


Under the influence of his mother, Moonbin debuted as a child model and *ulzzang* in 2004. His first known appearance was in 2006, where he appeared in TVXQ's music video for their song "Balloons" portraying a mini U-Know Yunho.[4] In 2009, he had his first acting role in the Korean drama *Boys over Flowers* where he played the younger version of Kim Bum's character.[5]


</fragment>

**Moonbin** (Korean: 문빈; January 26, 1998 – April 19, 2023), born as **Moon Bin**, was a South Korean singer, actor and dancer under the label Fantagio. He was a member of the South Korean boy group Astro and its sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha.

On November 12, 2019, Fantagio reported that due to health reasons, Moonbin would be absent from Astro's upcoming promotions for their *Blue Flame* EP release.[12] He ended his hiatus in February 2020 after appearing in a V Live broadcast with the other Astro members.[13] He was announced as one of the new hosts of the South Korean music show *Show Champion*, alongside his bandmate Yoon San-ha and Verivery's Kangmin.[14] He was confirmed to play the lead role in the web-drama *The Mermaid Prince*, a role which he reprised for a second season,[15][16] and joined the eco-friendly cooking program *Food Avengers*.[17]


In September 2020, Moonbin was announced as one of the fashion models for the brand Nerdy Cafe.[18] He and band-mate Sanha (Yoon San-ha) debuted as Astro's first sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha with the release of their debut EP, *In-Out*, along with its lead single, "Bad Idea", on September 14.[19] The unit received their first music show win from *The Show* eight days later.[20]

Moonbin was born on January 26, 1998, in Cheongju, Chungbuk Province. He attended and graduated from Hanlim Multi Art School, focusing in Practical Music.[2]


He was one of two siblings in his family, with a younger sister named Moon Sua, who is a member of the South Korean girl group Billlie.[3]



## Career[edit]


### 2006–2015: Pre-debut[edit]


Under the influence of his mother, Moonbin debuted as a child model and *ulzzang* in 2004. His first known appearance was in 2006, where he appeared in TVXQ's music video for their song "Balloons" portraying a mini U-Know Yunho.[4] In 2009, he had his first acting role in the Korean drama *Boys over Flowers* where he played the younger version of Kim Bum's character.[5]
